com.google.android.exoplayer.hls

Class HlsChunkSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.exoplayer.hls.HlsChunkSource

  • public class HlsChunkSource
extends Object
    A temporary test source of HLS chunks.

    TODO: Figure out whether this should merge with the chunk package, or whether the hls implementation is going to naturally diverge.

    • Field Detail

      • ADAPTIVE_MODE_NONE

        public static final int ADAPTIVE_MODE_NONE
        Adaptive switching is disabled.

        The initially selected variant will be used throughout playback.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ADAPTIVE_MODE_SPLICE

        public static final int ADAPTIVE_MODE_SPLICE
        Adaptive switches splice overlapping segments of the old and new variants.

        When performing a switch from one variant to another, overlapping segments will be requested from both the old and new variants. These segments will then be spliced together, allowing a seamless switch from one variant to another even if keyframes are misaligned or if keyframes are not positioned at the start of each segment.

        Note that where it can be guaranteed that the source content has keyframes positioned at the start of each segment, ADAPTIVE_MODE_ABRUPT should always be used in preference to this mode.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ADAPTIVE_MODE_ABRUPT

        public static final int ADAPTIVE_MODE_ABRUPT
        Adaptive switches are performed at segment boundaries.

        For this mode to perform seamless switches, the source content is required to have keyframes positioned at the start of each segment. If this is not the case a visual discontinuity may be experienced when switching from one variant to another.

        Note that where it can be guaranteed that the source content does have keyframes positioned at the start of each segment, this mode should always be used in preference to ADAPTIVE_MODE_SPLICE because it requires fetching less data.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_MIN_BUFFER_TO_SWITCH_UP_MS

        public static final long DEFAULT_MIN_BUFFER_TO_SWITCH_UP_MS
        The default minimum duration of media that needs to be buffered for a switch to a higher quality variant to be considered.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_MAX_BUFFER_TO_SWITCH_DOWN_MS

        public static final long DEFAULT_MAX_BUFFER_TO_SWITCH_DOWN_MS
        The default maximum duration of media that needs to be buffered for a switch to a lower quality variant to be considered.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_PLAYLIST_BLACKLIST_MS

        public static final long DEFAULT_PLAYLIST_BLACKLIST_MS
        The default time for which a media playlist should be blacklisted.
        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • HlsChunkSource

        public HlsChunkSource(DataSource dataSource,
              String playlistUrl,
              HlsPlaylist playlist,
              BandwidthMeter bandwidthMeter,
              int[] variantIndices,
              int adaptiveMode)

      • HlsChunkSource

        public HlsChunkSource(DataSource dataSource,
              String playlistUrl,
              HlsPlaylist playlist,
              BandwidthMeter bandwidthMeter,
              int[] variantIndices,
              int adaptiveMode,
              long minBufferDurationToSwitchUpMs,
              long maxBufferDurationToSwitchDownMs)
        Parameters:
        dataSource - A DataSource suitable for loading the media data.
        playlistUrl - The playlist URL.
        playlist - The hls playlist.
        bandwidthMeter - provides an estimate of the currently available bandwidth.
        variantIndices - If playlist is a HlsMasterPlaylist, the subset of variant indices to consider, or null to consider all of the variants. For other playlist types this parameter is ignored.
        adaptiveMode - The mode for switching from one variant to another. One of ADAPTIVE_MODE_NONE, ADAPTIVE_MODE_ABRUPT and ADAPTIVE_MODE_SPLICE.
        minBufferDurationToSwitchUpMs - The minimum duration of media that needs to be buffered for a switch to a higher quality variant to be considered.
        maxBufferDurationToSwitchDownMs - The maximum duration of media that needs to be buffered for a switch to a lower quality variant to be considered.

    • Method Detail

      • getDurationUs

        public long getDurationUs()

      • maybeThrowError

        public void maybeThrowError()
                     throws IOException
        If the source is currently having difficulty providing chunks, then this method throws the underlying error. Otherwise does nothing.
        Throws:
        IOException - The underlying error.

      • getChunkOperation

        public void getChunkOperation(TsChunk previousTsChunk,
                     long seekPositionUs,
                     long playbackPositionUs,
                     ChunkOperationHolder out)
        Updates the provided ChunkOperationHolder to contain the next operation that should be performed by the calling HlsSampleSource.
        Parameters:
        previousTsChunk - The previously loaded chunk that the next chunk should follow.
        seekPositionUs - If there is no previous chunk, this parameter must specify the seek position. If there is a previous chunk then this parameter is ignored.
        playbackPositionUs - The current playback position.
        out - The holder to populate with the result. ChunkOperationHolder.queueSize is unused.

      • onChunkLoadCompleted

        public void onChunkLoadCompleted(Chunk chunk)
        Invoked when the HlsSampleSource has finished loading a chunk obtained from this source.
        Parameters:
        chunk - The chunk whose load has been completed.

      • onChunkLoadError

        public boolean onChunkLoadError(Chunk chunk,
                       IOException e)
        Invoked when the HlsSampleSource encounters an error loading a chunk obtained from this source.
        Parameters:
        chunk - The chunk whose load encountered the error.
        e - The error.
        Returns:
        True if the error was handled by the source. False otherwise.

        public void reset()
